definition[0]: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
definition[1]: someone who dishonestly copies and sells another person’s work
example[0]: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
definition[2]: to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, DVD, or computer program
example[1]: pirated copies of the best-selling computer games
definition[3]: a person or organization that dishonestly copies and sells films, tapes etc for which the COPYRIGHT (=legal ownership) belongs to others
example[2]: Manufacturers fear that the city may emerge as a new centre for the software pirates.
definition[4]: illegal radio or television broadcasts, or the station sending them out
example[3]: About 80 pirate cable systems have brought US network news into thousands of homes.
definition[5]: a person who steals from a ship at sea
